text: one benefit of AWS code deploy is it
integrates nicely with your existing
software tool chain here I'm using
GitHub to manage the source code for a
website my team likes to use github's
collaboration features as we work
together on a project right now our
website consists of just the very simple
homepage but we're planning ahead for
success and we're running across
multiple Amazon ec2 instances for high
scale and
availability this page gives us a
special all up view of the website
across each of the three instances code
deploy makes it very easy to roll out
changes made to the website from GitHub
to these individual ec2 instances let's
go back to the GitHub project and
demonstrate how this
works we already connected this GitHub
repository to our application and code
deploy we've enabled a project to
automatically deploy deoy any new
change now we're going to make a couple
edits to
homepage let's change the background
color and the text on the
page we're going to hit commit and
GitHub will now automatically trigger a
new deployment for us through code
deploy if we look at the list of uh
deployments here we'll see at the top
code deploy has already started to kick
off or started to roll out the web page
update to each of the three
instances it does this one at a time to
ensure that at least two are always
available to serve
traffic we can watch the deployment on
our special all view and we see that two
of the instances have already been
updated in just a little while longer
all the instances will pick up the new
change so we started this deployment by
editing a file on GitHub but deployments
may also be started by pushing new
commits or by merging PLL
requests here we see that all three
instances have received the update now
if we go back to the console you'll see
that GitHub deployed the website to our
testing deployment group we'd like to do
some manual testing before we deploy a
change into our production environment
now that we verified that the change
looks good we can finish the
release by using Code deploy to automate
our deployments we're confident that we
can consistently deploy change to our
development testing and production
environments to do that I'm going to
select the last revision uh deployed and
now we're going to push it to production
we're going to hit deploy
now and now the latest change is being
deployed to our production instances in
exactly the same
manner so another benefit of code deploy
is it centralizes all your deployment
status and history to make it simple to
identify and diagnose any issues in our
list of recent deployments we can see
one of them had a problem
here was a deployment across six
instances that was stopped after a
failure on the first instance this is an
example of how code deploy helps prevent
downtime when a problem was detected on
the first
instance code deploy stopped deployment
from rolling out and taking any
additional instances offline so we can
quickly zero in on the root cause by
drilling into the deployment events on
the failed instance
here we can see that the deployment was
proceeding fine right up to the final
validate service step that executes our
custom application
tests to view the detailed error we can
even grab the tail of the deployment log
without having to SSH into the
instance here we see a failure in a test
case with its call
stack let's return back to the
deployments p
page and
here we see that the deployment we
started earlier to production has been
completed this demo showed how code
deploy automates application updates
across ec2 instances you can integrate
with developer tools like GitHub to
start deployments from your existing
workflows code deploy will coordinate
the deployment to minimize downtime and
keep your application available the code
deploy console gives you a centralized
control panel to manage deployments
across your environments identify any
problems and drill down the determined
root causes thank you all for watching
this demo for more information on AWS
code deploy and our GitHub integration
please visit aws.amazon.com
Cod deploy
